to.networld.schandler.card
Class BasicMifare

java.lang.Object
  to.networld.schandler.card.BasicCard
      to.networld.schandler.card.BasicMifare
All Implemented Interfaces:
ICard
public class BasicMifare
extends BasicCard

PC/SC 2.0 - Mifare Command APDU:

| 1 Byte | 1 Byte | 1 Byte | 1 Byte | 1 Byte | x Byte | 1 Byte |
|---------------------------------------------------------------------|
| CLA | INS | P1 | P2 | Lc | Data in | Le |

Lc ... The length of the "Data in" field.

Response APDU:

| x Byte | 1 Byte | 1 Byte |
----------------------------------------|
| Data out | SW2 | SW1 |

Author:
Alex Oberhauser

readBlockData

public javax.smartcardio.ResponseAPDU readBlockData(byte _keyType,
                                                    byte[] _key,
                                                    byte _msb,
                                                    byte _lsb,
                                                    byte _keyNumber)
                                             throws java.lang.Exception
1. Load the key into the memory.
2. Authenticate with the previously loaded key.
3. Read data from the card The following example should work with a new Mifare 1K/4K card:

  • _keyType = 0x60
  • _key = 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF
  • _accessStart = 0x00
  • _accessEnd = 0x00
  • _keyNumber = 0x01

Parameters:
_keyType - Could be 0x60 for KeyA or 0x61 for KeyB
_key - The key as byte array.
_msb - The beginning of the area that is accessed.
_lsb - The end of the area that is accessed. From 0x00 (dec: 0) to 0x3F (dec: 63)
_keyNumber - 0x01, 0x1A, 0x1B should work as key number.
Returns:
If no error had occurred the data from the card.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

readData

public java.lang.String readData(byte _keyType,
                                 byte[] _key,
                                 byte _keyNumber)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
Beginning from the 0x01 block until a 0x00 Byte is reached. Returns the found data as String.

Parameters:
_keyType - Could be 0x60 for KeyA or 0x61 for KeyB
_key - The key as byte array.
_keyNumber - 0x01, 0x1A, 0x1B should work as key number.
Returns:
The found data as String.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

writeBlockData

public javax.smartcardio.ResponseAPDU writeBlockData(byte _keyType,
                                                     byte[] _key,
                                                     byte _msb,
                                                     byte _lsb,
                                                     byte _keyNumber,
                                                     byte[] _data)
                                              throws java.lang.Exception
1. Load the key into the memory.
2. Authenticate with the previously loaded key.
3. Write Data to the block.

The following example should work with a new Mifare 1K/4K card:

  • _keyType = 0x60
  • _key = 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF
  • _accessStart = 0x00
  • _accessEnd = 0x00
  • _keyNumber = 0x01

Parameters:
_keyType - Could be 0x60 for KeyA or 0x61 for KeyB
_key - The key as byte array.
_msb - The beginning of the area that is accessed.
_lsb - The end of the area that is accessed. From 0x00 (dec: 0) to 0x39 (dec: 63)
_keyNumber - 0x01, 0x1A, 0x1B should work as key number.
Returns:
If no error had occurred the data from the card.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

writeData

public void writeData(byte _keyType,
                      byte[] _key,
                      byte _keyNumber,
                      byte[] _data)
               throws java.lang.Exception
1. Load the key into the memory.
2. Authenticate with the previously loaded key.
3. Write Data to the blocks.

The following example should work with a new Mifare 1K/4K card:

  • _keyType = 0x60
  • _key = 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF
  • _accessStart = 0x00
  • _accessEnd = 0x00
  • _keyNumber = 0x01

Parameters:
_keyType - Could be 0x60 for KeyA or 0x61 for KeyB
_key - The key as byte array.
_keyNumber - 0x01, 0x1A, 0x1B should work as key number.
_data - The data to write as byte array.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
